definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Tara - an animal lover, she volunteers at a variety of local Animal Shelters.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個動物情人，她在當地許多的動物收容所服務。

sentences.english: I met Connie the day she was admitted to the hospice room, where I worked as a volunteer.
sentences.chinese: 我是在康妮住進收容所病房的那天見到她的。

sentences.english: In Massachusetts, homeless shelters are at capacity.
sentences.chinese: 馬薩諸塞州的收容所已經爆滿。

sentences.english: Beth Hemmer's 13-year-old daughter Lena has volunteered at the shelter for two years.
sentences.chinese: 貝絲13歲的女兒在收容所已經做了兩年的志願者了。

sentences.english: And with one long last look, I turned and left the hospice.
sentences.chinese: 最後久久地凝視了她一眼，我轉身離開了收容所。

sentences.english: On landing, we immediately sought asylum.
sentences.chinese: 下了飛機，我們立刻尋找收容所。

sentences.english: We are looking for other sites for new camps.
sentences.chinese: 我們也正在尋找修建其他的新收容所的位址。

sentences.english: It also recommended the splitting of the hospice's adult and children's services into two.
sentences.chinese: 還有人建議把收容所分爲成年人部和兒童部。

sentences.english: Scott was robbed once and picked up lice the second time.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在收容所被搶過一次，還兩次被除蝨。

sentences.english: Out of 97 cats at the shelter, 28 are black, Morgan said.
sentences.chinese: 摩根說收容所共有97只貓，其中28只爲黑色。

sentences.english: The young gunman was tried before a juvenile court and sent to a detention center.
sentences.chinese: 少年槍犯在少年法庭接受了審判，然後被送到收容所。

sentences.english: After talking to the children, Bilaal's father brought him to the shelter.
sentences.chinese: 和孩子們談過之後，比拉艾的父親把他帶到了收容所。

sentences.english: But obviously, a lot of the shelter dogs are mutts like me," he quipped.
sentences.chinese: 很顯然，大多收容所裏的狗都像我一樣，是混血的。

sentences.english: I’m on my way to a hospice.
sentences.chinese: 我這是去臨終老人收容所。

sentences.english: Starving and abandoned children were taken from the streets to orphan asylums. Ufa, 1922
sentences.chinese: 從街上找到的飢餓的被遺棄的孩子被送到孤兒收容所。

sentences.english: By the time we arrived at the shelter both those dogs were gone.
sentences.chinese: 等我們趕到收容所時，這兩隻狗都已經被領走了。

definition: to provide a place to stay/to house/to accommodate/(of an institution etc) to take in/to accept
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
